titleStmt.title: SII 14.255: original edition by A. S. Ramanatha Ayyar
No. 255. (A.R. Nos. 319 and 320 of 1908.) KURUVITTUṞAI, NILAKKOTTAI TALUK, MADURAI DISTRICT. ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE CHITRARATHAVALLABHA-PERUMĀḶ TEMPLE.

summary.p: These two complementary inscriptions are dated in the 22nd year of an unspecified king who was evidently Jaṭāvarmaṉ Śrīvallabha. One of them is an order (ōlai) issued by Kāliṅgarājaṉ to the Śrīvaishṇavas of the temple intimating the fact that the lands mentioned in No. 254 above belonging to the Chakkrattāḻvār temple were made tax-free, and the second gives publicity to this exemption granted on these lands.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . kāliṅkarāyaṉa Olai . pākanūrk* kūṟṟattu coḻāntakaccatu rvvetimaṅkalattut tiruccakkarattāḷvār koyilil śrī(ti)vayiṣaṇavaṟkku . I Āḷ vārkku muṉpu Ivūril tevatāṉa Iṟaiyiliyākap parākkirama pāṇṭiyaṉ kaṭṭaḷaiyile tiṟanta nilam Aiveliyum paḷaiyaṭṭiye Iṟaiyiliyākavum Ikkoyilil Antarāyamum yāṇṭu 2 10 2 Āvatu mutal Antarāyam Uḷpaṭa tevatāṉa Iṟaii
liyāka tantomeṉṟu prasādam ceytaruḷiṉa tirumukamum puravariyār Eḻuttiṭṭa Uḷ variyum pontatu tāṅkaḷ I Antarāyamum Inilattāl Uḷḷatum koṇṭu tiruppaṭi māṟṟuḷḷiṭṭa ṉimantaṅkaḷum tiruppaṇiyum cellappaṇṇuka . Itu kallilum cempilum veṭṭi koḷka . Ivai kāliṅkarāyaṉ Eḻuttu . Ivai puravari tiṉaikkaḷaṉāyakam veḷiyāṟṟūr Uṭaiyāṉ Eḻuttu .

svasti śrī .
pākaṉūrk kūṟṟattuc coḻāṉtakaccaruppetimaṅkalattu tiruccakkarattāḷvārkku yāṇṭu 2 10 2Āvatu tiruppaṭimāṟṟuḷḷiṭṭu veṇṭu nimantaṅkaḷukkum Iv Āḷvārkku tiruppaṇiceykaikkum Iāḷvār tevatāṉam Iṟaiiliil teṉkarai parākkiramapāṇṭiyan kaṭṭaḷaiyil muṉpu tevatāṉam Iṟaiiliyāy niṉṟa nilattil muṉpu tiṟaṉta nilam Aiyveliyum pa
ḻampaṭiye tevatāṉa Iṟaiili Iṭṭamaikkum I Āḷvār Antarāyam Uḷpaṭa Iṟaiiṉi Iṭṭamai .
Digital edition of SII 14.255 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
